thread.title_full: Clinton National Airport Again Scores Higher than National Average for Passenger SatisfactionTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Clinton National Airport Again Scores Higher than National Average for Passenger SatisfactionTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Clinton National Airport Again Scores Higher than National Average for Passenger Satisfaction
The Little Rock Municipal Airport Commission, the governing body of Bill and Hillary Clinton National Airport, has released the airport’s passenger satisfaction survey results for the 2nd Quarter of 2015. 92% of passengers surveyed are satisfied with their overall experience at Clinton National, a score that is 11 percentage points above the national average. The independently conducted research was performed by Phoenix Marketing International, and has a 95% confidence level.
Phoenix, an industry leader known for reviewing and analyzing airport performance, recently completed the research as a part of the airport’s customer service initiatives.
Passengers surveyed were most satisfied with getting to the terminal, ticket lobby check-in, TSA Security and terminal facilities.
The airport’s food and retail options scored the lowest; however, those scores are at the national average of where most airports are ranked. Phoenix interviewed 400 departing passengers between April and June with nine out of ten passengers reporting they are satisfied with the airport. Phoenix Marketing International is currently conducting research at several airports across the country.
Last year, the company surveyed 35,000 passengers. It will continue to survey passengers at Clinton National throughout the year. Clinton National Airport is currently working on a $20.6 million concourse renovation. New concourse restrooms opened in June while the overall concourse is planned to be remodeled next year. Clinton National has already undergone nearly $70 million in renovations that were completed in 2013.
Source:- Clinton National Airport
